children.subject: One B+ in a hard Berk EECS course like 127 wont be the reason you get rejected if you do

history.content:
I thought I had a pretty stable A- in 127 after the recent midterm considering all other graded components. However, due to some comment thread of how to interpret their midterm grade bins, I actually have a risk (based on the midterm score reported) of getting a B+ in 127 and have closer to a low A- / risk of B+. I'm actually at the border now. I personally had a bad day during the midterm and am taking the class pretty isolated (After going through course staff practice material, I couldn't tell if my understanding of the class material is good or not overall because of the isolation - but the bin was quite low, and I did badly), and I have to figure out if I can do better on the final than the midterm now that I know what kind of understanding they're looking for. I got As in previous classes/prerequisites relatively comfortably, but online learning has taken a toll... 

I am still scared of my grade and I'm trying to figure out studying for the class this weekend in terms of grasping the material. But before starting, is a B+ going to affect my chances for grad programs if ML is something I want to potentially apply for? (Assume I have everything else pretty set, but this grade...). If I don't feel confident by the end of this weekend, I am thinking of late dropping the class and retaking it in a future semester, but I still don't know because I really want to finish this course... I am also taking other technicals so deferring isn't an issue if it really comes to that, although my schedule won't be perfect.

Also, this is the covid semester. I don't know if they'll take that, though....

I'm looking for any advice because I intend to stay in the class but I'm afraid of the risk of a B+
